parameters.content:
## Automatically send your daily schedule to Teams
1) "Code" node - setting TODAY value 
2) "Microsoft Outlook" node - set Resource as EVENT and operation as GET MANY 
3) "Code" node - HTML-formatted message for each item, summarizing the meeting time, subject, and body preview, using default values if fields are missing.
4) Send the message via "MS Teams node" - use technical user & select relevant teams channel or chat

## Final Output
### Received in teams chat 
📅 Meeting Time: 2025-07-08T13:00:00.0000000
📝 Subject: Name of Example Meeting
📄 Summary:
Agenda:
🟢 Quick check-in on project status
📊 Review of key KPIs from last week
🛠️ Discussion on blockers and resource needs
📆 Planning milestones for the upcoming sprint
❓ Q&A + feedback round
________________________________________________________________________________ Microsoft Teams Need help? [Join the meeting now] Meeting ID: 123 456 789 000 Passcode: aB1c2DE3________________________________ For organizers:

## Daily Summary of your Outlook calendar to MS Teams **No need to open your calendar – get a clear daily agenda delivered to your Teams channel. Use this workflow.** ### About Workflow This workflow sends an automatic daily summary of your Outlook calendar events into a Microsoft Teams channel. Perfect for team visibility or personal reminders. ### Use Case Teams can stay prepared for morning syncs or personal planning by using the tool as a daily agenda or simple reminder. It provides visibility into shared calendars and helps organize workflows without the need to open a calendar, making it ideal for structured team coordination. ### How it works - Scheduled trigger will ensure the automatic run => every midnight - Code node generates the date value for "today" => Calculates UTC start and end of the current day => Builds a Microsoft Graph-compatible filter string - Microsoft Outlook node retrieves all calendar events for the day => Resource : Event | Operation : Get Many => Uses {{ $json.filter }} based on the "today" date to get only relevant entries - Code node transforms each event into a formatted HTML message => Example Output: Meeting Time: 2025-07-08T10:00:00Z
Subject: Weekly Sync
Summary:
- Send to MS Teams - by native MS Teams node => Chat Message | Create | Selected Channel | HTML content => Uses the htmlMessage field from the previous node as the message body ### How to use - Adjust the schedule time to match your working hours or timezone - Customize the Teams channel or chat to match your team’s setup - Modify the HTML format to include more fields (e.g. location, organizer) - Use the workflow for multiple teams ### Requirements - MS Outlook => ideally technical user for API calls with specific permissions - MS Teams => ideally technical user for API calls with specific permissions ### Need Help? - Reach out through n8n community => https://community.n8n.io/u/easy8.ai - Contant our team directly => Easy8.ai - Visit our youtube channel => https://www.youtube.com/@easy8ai

_metadata.name: Automate Daily Outlook Calendar Digests to Microsoft Teams
